title: How to Prepare Simple One Bite Appetizers

methods.name: Assembling Mozzarella and Cherry Tomato Skewers

steps.headline: Mix the olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Add ¼ cup (59 ml) of extra virgin olive oil, 1 minced garlic clove, and sea salt and freshly ground pepper to taste to a large bowl. Stir the ingredients well to ensure that they're fully blended. If you prefer a stronger garlic flavor, you can add extra cloves of minced garlic. To give the skewers a spicy kick, mix a pinch of crushed red pepper flakes into the olive oil mixture.

steps.headline: Toss the mozzarella in the olive oil mixture.
steps.description: After you've mixed the olive oil with the seasonings, add 48 baby mozzarella balls to the bowl. Use tongs or a wooden spoon to toss the mozzarella in the oil so it's well coated. Baby mozzarella is often sold as bocconcini. If you can't find the baby mozzarella, you can use a block of regular mozzarella. Just cut it into bite-size pieces.

steps.headline: Slide a piece of mozzarella, a basil leaf, and a cherry tomato on the skewer.
steps.description: Take a toothpick or wooden skewer, and slide one piece of the mozzarella on it. Next, add a leaf of fresh basil and a ripe cherry tomato. You can create as many layers of each ingredient as you'd like. However, using one of each usually makes the appetizer easier to eat.

steps.headline: Top the skewer with another piece of mozzarella and place on a platter to serve.
steps.description: After you've arranged the mozzarella, basil leaf, and cherry tomato on the skewer, add one final piece of mozzarella to top the skewer. Set the finished skewer on a plate, and repeat the process with all remaining cheese, tomato, and basil.

methods.name: Creating Blue Cheese and Bacon Lettuce Boats

steps.headline: Combine the yogurt, garlic, lemon juice, honey, and half of the blue cheese.
steps.description: Add ⅔ cup (165 g) of whole-milk yogurt, 1 finely grated clove of garlic, 2 teaspoons (30 ml) of fresh lemon juice, ½ teaspoon (3 ½ g) of honey, and 3 ounces (85 g) of crumbled blue cheese to a medium bowl. Stir the ingredients together well with a spoon, making sure to break up the cheese. Don't use Greek yogurt in this recipe. Plain yogurt is the best option.

steps.headline: Season the yogurt mixture with salt and pepper.
steps.description: After you've prepared the yogurt mixture, add some kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. It's a good idea to taste the mixture so you know how much salt and pepper that you want to mix in.

steps.headline: Spoon some of the mixture on the lettuce leaves and top with bacon and cheese.
steps.description: Once you've seasoned the yogurt mixture, take the leaves from 2 heads of Little Gem lettuce and place a 1 to 2 teaspoons (5 to 10 g) of the mixture in the center of the leaves. Next, use 6 ounces (170 g) of cooked and chopped bacon and the remaining 3 ounces (85 g) of crumbled blue cheese to top all of the lettuce boats. You can use the spoon to spread the yogurt mixture slightly to ensure that it's evenly distributed across the center of the leaves.

steps.headline: Place the boats on a platter with chives and lemon wedges to serve.
steps.description: Once you've filled all of the lettuce boats, arrange them on a serving platter. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons (6 g) of finely chopped chives over the lettuce boats for garnish. Add several lemon wedges to the platter so you can squeeze them over the boats when serving. You can omit the chives if you prefer.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven and grease the pan.
steps.description: Set the oven temperature to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius) and allow it to preheat. Next, spray 2 nonstick mini-muffin tins that have 24 cups with nonstick cooking spray. You can grease the muffin tins with butter if you prefer.

steps.headline: Sprinkle parsley and scallions in bottom of muffin cups.
steps.description: After you've greased the muffin tins, take 6 thinly sliced scallions and 2 tablespoons (5 g) of chopped fresh parsley and sprinkle them in the bottom of each muffin cup. Be sure to spread them as evenly as possible among the cups.

steps.headline: Mix the eggs, yolks, parmesan cheese, milk, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Add 6 large eggs plus 3 large egg yolks, ½ cup (50 g) of grated parmesan cheese, 1 ½ cups (365 ml) of milk, and salt and pepper to taste to a large bowl. Use a whisk to blend the ingredients together until the mixture is smooth. For the best results, use whole milk in the mini quiches.

steps.headline: Fill each muffin cup with the egg mixture.
steps.description: Once you've mixed the ingredients, transfer the mixture to a measuring cup or another container with a pour spout. Pour enough of the egg mixture to fill all of the cups into the muffin tin. The quiches will puff up as they bake so don't fill the the cups to the brim. Aim for 1 to 2 inches (2.5- to 5-cm) from the top.

steps.headline: Top each mini quiche with Swiss cheese.
steps.description: After you've filled the muffin tins, use ½ cup (53 g) of shredded Swiss Cheese to top all of the quiches. Add a small pinch of the cheese to each cup. You can substitute your favorite cheese for the Swiss if you prefer. Cheddar and mozzarella are good options.

steps.headline: Bake the quiches until the tops are brown.
steps.description: Place the muffin tins in the heated oven. Allow them to bake for approximately 15 minutes, and then rotate the pans. Let the quiches cook for another 15 minutes or until the tops become golden brown. The quiches will also puff up when they're finished baking.

steps.headline: Transfer the quiches to a cooling rack to cool.
steps.description: As soon as you take the muffin tins out of the oven, run a sharp knife around each quiche. Turn the tray over to remove the quiches, and place them on a wire rack to cool. Let the quiche cool for at least 5 minutes. You can serve them warm, but you don't want them so hot that they'll burn you.

steps.headline: Arrange the quiches on a platter to serve.
steps.description: When the quiches are cool enough to handle, set them out on a platter. You can serve them warm or at room temperature. You can make the quiches the day before. Store them in the refrigerator, and reheat them in the microwave briefly before you plan to serve them.

steps.headline: Cut the cheese into pieces.
steps.description: Take ¼ pound (113 g) of extra sharp auricchio provolone cheese and use a sharp knife to cut it into small pieces. You want the pieces to be small enough to fit inside the peppers so aim for 1-inch cubes. If you prefer, you can substitute mozzarella for the auricchio provolone.

steps.headline: Wrap the cheese with the prosciutto.
steps.description: After you've cut the cheese into pieces, cut 5 slices of thin prosciutto in half. Next, place several cubes of the cheese in the center of each piece of prosciutto and wrap the ham around the cheese in a bundle.

steps.headline: Stuff the wrapped cheese in the peppers.
steps.description: Use a knife to cut the stems off 10 spicy cherry peppers and scrape out the seeds to create a well. Place one of the prosciutto and provolone bundles in each pepper to fill it. If you aren't a fan of spicy foods, you can substitute cherry tomatoes for the peppers.

steps.headline: Marinate the peppers in olive oil overnight.
steps.description: Place the stuffed peppers in a bowl, and pour ½ cup (118 ml) of extra virgin olive oil over them. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate the peppers. Allow them to marinate in the oil overnight.

steps.headline: Bring the peppers to room temperature and transfer them to a platter.
steps.description: An hour or two before you plan to serve the peppers, remove the bowl from the refrigerator and set them out to come to room temperature. Place them on a platter to serve. You may want to serve the stuffed peppers with toothpicks. The oil makes them greasy so they can be slightly messy to pick up with fingers.
